Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ERRANTTRAVELERE
Reviews.Content: I am admittedly someone who is difficult to please however I will also be the first to praise a place when I have good stay. I was recently at this location on business and initially was placed in a room near the elevator despite a prior request for one farther away. I was a little unhappy to find nothing was available however the front desk clerk did some searching and was able to find something for me during the time I went to my car to grab my bags. I sincerely appreciated his efforts. Overall the hotel appears to be newer with modern decor and furniture and an air conditioning system that works very well. The room was very clean and the mattress firm. The water coming out of the shower seemed rather weak but nothing that I could not deal with. I took advantage of the gym and found the machines functioning well and consisting of two treadmills, a stair climber, a bike and a pulley machine. I also used the mini office and found the equipment working properly. Breakfast does need some work. The food was heavily salted and my despite two requests, the waiter continued to forget to bring coffee and then forgot cream. i finally ended up getting up and getting the items myself. I am sure this is something that can be corrected. In general I would recommend this location and plan on staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Family-o-Six
Reviews.Content: I was only at this hotel for a one night business stay. The staff was friendly and professional. The facility was very clean. We did have a business meeting on site. The meeting space was adequate, and lunch was good. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay while on business”
Reviews.Author: crossbordergirl
Reviews.Content: I have been to Indianapolis many times on business, stayed in numerous different hotels, this one by far is the best, the cleanest, most amenities, convient right off the highway, not too far from the airport yet far enough feels much more comfortable, conveniently located across from a mall, grocery store, couple of restaurants yet property is on it's own so no noise or lights from those. Staff are very nice there. Be prepared there is no free breakfast, restaurant in the hotel has good food but pricey. Have a fully equipped small gym, a pool, and rooms are very spacious. If you have a suite that has a whirlpool be prepared they are not well cleaned, I filled up the tub and when I turned the jets on a whole bunch of black stuff came out, so my advice is don't bother spending the extra money on the suite with the whirlpool yuck! but all i all a very great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mollymop12
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great, hotel staff was fantastic. The only negative was the restaurant was a little put of sorts-food was cold and out of sorts-but was told they just done a staff over haul so it should get better.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel close enought to Lucas Oil Stadium”
Reviews.Author: IAHawkeyes99
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn South after the Big Ten Championship game (Go Green!) and the hotel was nice and new. It was very clean and the rooms were quite. We stayed in a king whirlpool suite. It was a large room. almost too large for the amount of furniture it had. My fiance enjoyed the tub the morning after the game. She said the jets were nice but the tub was too short. Made for someone 5'0" or smaller. One important thing to note is the bed. The bed was a comfort control bed, meaning you can adjust the firmness of softness on each side by adjusting a dial. When we first laid down the bed was VERY hard and uncomfortable. We adjust our respective dials to soft and the bed remained hard. After about an hour the bed started to get softer. The bed must have continued to soften as the night went on because when we woke up it was perfect. We both had a great night sleep. My advice would be to adjust the bed to your liking as soon as you get in the room, so your not uncomfortable when you first go to bed. Breakfast was included with our room. The kitchen was "indisposed" (as the waitress told us) so the only thing available was the buffet. (odd that the kitchen was indisposed for menu items but it was ok for cooking buffet items) It was as good as a buffet could get. The service was good and the dinning area was clean. The hotel does have a bar area that I overheard someone saying was open until 4AM. I would guess that was because there was a group of people from the game having drinks and as long as there is business they will stay open. Overall a excellent hotel at this class level. I travel for work and have stayed at many hotels that are supposed to be at this level and this was one of the nicest.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ComebackShane
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and clean hotel. I have no complaints about the room. Since I am a little picky, I wil complain that you will pay $10 for a breakfast. Now its a real breakfast and you can get eggs done anyway you like, meats, pancakes, etc. But sometimes I only wants a bagel and cupo of coffee. Dont really want to spend $10 for that. Other than that, very nice. Beds were comfortable. Bar staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: PiccolaChef
Reviews.Content: I booked a Saturday night stay in a King whirlpool suite. I couldn't believe the space in this room and the bathroom had a separate glass shower from the whirlpool tub (very nice). Comfortable bed with lots of pillows 7 a comfy chair with ottoman for lounging and watching tv. My husband used the desk area with plenty of room to spread out with his laptop & snack. Even though you don't get complementary breakfast you do have a mini fridge, coffee maker & microwave. This hotel also has a great bar/lounge that you just don't see anymore. VERY Chic but comfortable and a full restaurant American Grill. We didn't eat there so I can't comment on that. They also have a pool and hot tub & a separate fitness room. Check in was fast and friendly. We would definitely stay here again. Check out online specials through the Hilton website i got a great deal on our upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: NoVaVol
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. Bugs, bugs and more bugs. I actually signed up for Trip Advisor just to warn you about this establishment. I stayed there and ended up calling Hilton Hotels customer service at 2am about this issue (because the creepy crawlies kept me up). They said they would get back to me in no later than 3 days. Guess what? Nothing. I even called them back and e-mailed them regarding this issue. Nothing. Good luck sleeping with a bunch of cockroaches.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bronx24
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Very clean rooms and the staff would always go above and beyond, especially Randy and Maria. We stayed there for almost a week for my sisters wedding and had booked several rooms, everyone was very satisfied. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but...Pillows Were Like Sacks of Cement”
Reviews.Author: BigBobQChicago
Reviews.Content: The wife and I did an overnighter here attending a family function off-site. The room was beautiful, relatively new and scratch-free. A relative stayed here at the same time and except for a king vs. twin beds, the rooms were identical. Everything worked. I liked the well-organized hutch containing the coffee brewer. micro and fridge. The king-sized bed, albeit a set-your-own-firmness mattress came with a multitude of smaller, square-shaped pillows, each one less comfortable than the last one. I refer to them as "cement sacks." Neither of us got a good night's sleep account of the pillows. The next morning a bunch of us ate breakfast together in their grill. There was a choice of the buffet or order from the menu. I checked out the buffet and saw several items were out or low and I advised the cook staff who's body language told me my advice was not appreciated. They did replenish those items quickly to their credit. The food was just OK, not bad but nothing special. I enjoy biscuits and gravy when traveling and was slightly disappointed in the gravy that was pretty bland tasting. Our waitress to her credit was very obliging and informative. I would stay there again in the future and call housekeeping for softer pillows if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthBendMC
Reviews.Content: I stayed on 8/5/2011 with my family for one night. The room was nicely decorated. It was pretty clean. There was no road noise that I could discern even though we could see the interstate. Also there was no noise on the floor despite having many swimmers staying there for a meet. There are quite a few restaurants nearby as well as good shopping a couple miles West. We didn't eat at the Hotel, but it seemed to be doing a good business in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Quality furnishings, Great service”
Reviews.Author: Foo-D-GR
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Garden is a few years old now, but is maintained perfectly - no detail is overlooked from the grounds to the lobby to the rooms. The staff caters to every need and the breakfast is served full service. The rooms are spacious and furnished very nicely. Business travelers will appreciate the desk and chair combo as well as free wi-fi and plugs available. This is my second stay at this hotel and I find it enjoyable to return in the evening after a long day. What I noticed is that the rooms are very, very quiet here. You don't hear much of anything happening in the hallway or other rooms. Note: The address on Noggle Way is too new for some GPS units, so use the Greenwood Airport for a quick to find the route. The hotel is at the intersection of I-65 and Countyline Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean newer hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessfl11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on business recently. I was very impressed by the cleanliness of the room. They have free wi-fi, a beautiful lobby, and a good restaurant that also offers room service. There is a microwave and mini-fridge in the room with a Kroger's across the street if you prefer to buy a few groceries and have a meal in your room. The staff was very nice and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again if in the Greenwood area in the future.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean hotel...nice neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggers5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for business trip. New Hilton Garden Inn, with new sleep beds. One complaint is typical with all new HGI's...they are making the rooms smaller. Nice lobby and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean...friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: greekinthenati
Reviews.Content: I was impressed upon entering the hotel. It was very open and comfortable in the lobby. The staff was very friendly. We requested an early check-in but they were not able to get a room ready before regular check-in. That didn't really bother me because it was not guaranteed. The full breakfast looked good but it was $10 per person...a bit pricey so we opted to go out. There is a Kroger across the street and some nice local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place and would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: luckylab13
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights June 4 & 5. We did not have a reservation and stopped at several other places and they didn't have rooms. We are so glad they didn't! The Assistant Manager Randy Hayes was working the front desk when we arrived. He was one of the nicest front desk people we have ever encountered. He informed us that there was a childrens soccer tournament in town but he had a room available and placed us away from the kids as much as possible. It was a little noisy but not the hotel's fault. When you have many kids you have noise. The room was clean and the beds were delightful. We continually saw Randy throughout our stay doing all sorts of things to make guests comfortable. The hotel is wonderful but Randy made it GREAT! The pool was too crowded to enjoy but looked great! The breakfast was a little expensive but the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dilligaf217
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone to this hotel for business. I choose the hotel and was very happy, though my stay was short. Hotel was very clean, easily accessible off the freeway, staff was very helpful, rooms clean, HD tv in my room. My only complaint would be that the in-room fridge was a little noisy and kept waking me up, but overall, I would stay here again, no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Highway Location”
Reviews.Author: travelsavage51
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel. It is clean and has most of the amenities anyone could want while traveling. I had a room overlooking the exit ramp of I-65. Yes, there was some traffic noise. It didn't bother me. If the hotel didn't have what you wanted there were plenty of businesses nearby that did. Try the Smokey Bones for barbecue about 1.5 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations but . . . . . . . . .”
Reviews.Author: hef48
Reviews.Content: Requested extra pillows (4) three times and received one 7-1/2 hours later. Couldn't hear TV or sleep due to noisy heater.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but NOISY”
Reviews.Author: debrabikerchickie
Reviews.Content: Lobby is BEAUTIFUL. The free breakfast was delicious, and there was an extensive menu to choose from. Chef was very nice, came out to make sure our meal was good, but his clothes were absolutely filthy, and kind of ruined our appetite. Biggest problem was the noise. This hotel is right off the ramp at I-65 and County Line Road, and I heard EVERY single semi truck grinding their gears ALL NIGHT LONG. We stayed in the back of the hotel, so maybe that was the problem. But the room was clean, and overall, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience all around. Would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: gordonc01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in MANY hotels with my job and this Hilton Garden Inn, at Greenwood, was top of the line. I was pleased with all parts of my stay here, and not once but night after night. I had the opportunity to stay in this hotel about 15 nights in the past few months and it was a joy! The rooms were clean and comfortable, very inviting. The food was excellent, and I had many a meal there. Lastly, the staff was outstanding - extremely helpful and friendly - everyone from the front desk, to the manger and from the chefs to everyone in the serving and bar area. They made me feel at home and comfortable. I would highly suggest this hotel for anyone, at any time.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel, just off the interstate. Some food options nearby (driviing). Front desk was very nice and efficient. Great hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis South/Greenwood
HotelInfo.Address: 5255 Noggle Way, Indianapolis, IN 46237
